descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course examines the cognitive, neurobiological, and linguistic aspects of bilingualism. We will examine topics such as; the acquisition of two or more languages by children and adults; the brain mechanisms involved in bilingual language processing; how bilinguals control what linguistic system they use to guide processing; and the consequences of bilingualism for other aspects of cognition.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Recognize the structure of cognitive, linguistic, and neuroscientific theories of bilingual language processing; learn how to connect such theories to empirical data.
